qas.question: Who do Jehovah Witnesses believe is God's only direct creation?
What was Jesus a ransom sacrifice to pay for?
What do Jehovah Witnesses believe Jesus died on rather than a traditional cross?
Jesus is considered to be the only what between God and humanity?
What biblical passage outlines Jesus' role as a mediator?
What Christian religion believes Jesus died on a cross?
What do Catholics think God created?
Who do Catholics think Archangel Michael is?
Which religion believes people are free of original sin?
Who do Catholics think Abaddon is?

context: <b5_0><b8_0>Jehovah's Witnesses<b8_0/><b5_0/> believe that <a0_0>Jesus<a0_0/> is God's only direct creation, that <b6_0>everything<b6_0/> else was created by means of Christ, and that the initial unassisted act of creation uniquely identifies Jesus as God's "only-begotten Son". Jesus served as a redeemer and a ransom sacrifice to pay for <a1_0>the sins of humanity<a1_0/>. They believe Jesus died on <a2_0>a single upright post<a2_0/> rather than the traditional cross. They believe that references in the Bible to the Archangel Michael, Abaddon (Apollyon), and the Word all refer to <b7_0><b9_0>Jesus<b9_0/><b7_0/>. Jesus is considered to be the only <a3_0>intercessor and high priest<a3_0/> between God and humanity, and appointed by God as the king and judge of his kingdom. His role as a mediator (referred to in <a4_0>1 Timothy 2:5<a4_0/>) is applied to the 'anointed' class, though the 'other sheep' are said to also benefit from the arrangement.
